  • All Classes
 

All Classes

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Band
    Contains methods that are useful for handling band conditions.
    Binary_Join_Unranked  
    Binary_Partitioning
    Contains methods for efficiently representing (or factorizing) the query results of a join between 2 relations where the join condition is a conjunction of equalities/inequalities/non-equalities/bands.
    BinaryRandomPattern
    A subclass of the data generator Database_Query_Generator.
    BinaryStar_Equijoin
    This class provides a main function that receives execution parameters from the command line and runs experiments for equi-join queries where the joined relations are binary and organized in a star.
    Common
    This class contains static methods that are generally useful and may be used by multiple other classes.
    CompileTimeConfig  
    Configuration
    This class contains parameters that configure the execution of any-k algorithms.
    Cycle_HeavyLightPattern
    A subclass of the data generator @link data.Database_Query_Generator} for simple cycle queries.
    Database_Query_Generator
    Abstract class for a synthetic data generator.
    DatabaseParser
    A class that reads a database as a list of relations from an input file.
    DP_All
    All is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements DP_All.get_successors(entities.paths.DP_Decision) by treating all the non-optimal decisions as successors of the best (optimal) decision.
    DP_Anyk_Iterator
    A ranked enumeration algorithm for a DP problem specified by a DP_Problem_Instance object.
    DP_Decision
    A DP decision that corresponds to an edge in the multi-stage graph.
    DP_DecisionSet
    Class that represents a set of decisions (outgoing edges in the DP graph), each one leading to a different target.
    DP_Eager
    Eager is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements DP_Eager.get_successors(entities.paths.DP_Decision) by sorting the decision set eagerly (upon the first visit with DP_Eager.initialize_partial_order(entities.paths.DP_DecisionSet)).
    DP_Lazy
    Lazy is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements DP_Lazy.get_successors(entities.paths.DP_Decision) by popping them from a priority queue.
    DP_Part
    Implementation of Anyk-Part for DP, a ranked enumeration algorithm that relies on the Lawler procedure.
    DP_PartPlus
    Implementation of Anyk-PartMemoized for DP, a ranked enumeration algorithm that improves upon DP_Part by adding certain memoization.
    DP_Path_Equijoin_Instance
    A class for DP problems that are equi-join path queries.
    DP_Path_ThetaJoin_Instance
    A class for DP problems that are theta-join path queries.
    DP_Prefix_Solution
    A prefix representation of DP solutions that allows for sharing common prefixes.
    DP_Prefix_Solution_Follower
    A follower solution follows the order that some other "leading" prefix solution discovers.
    DP_Problem_Instance
    An instance of a DP problem realized as a multi-stage graph of state-nodes where the stages are organized in a path (chain).
    DP_Quick
    Quick is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements DP_Quick.get_successors(entities.paths.DP_Decision) by incrementally sorting the decision set with Incremental QuickSort (IQS).
    DP_QuickPlus
    QuickMemoized is a variant of Anyk-PartMemoized that implements DP_QuickPlus.get_successors(entities.paths.DP_Decision) by incrementally sorting the decision set with Incremental QuickSort (IQS).
    DP_Recursive
    Implementation of Anyk-Rec for DP, a ranked enumeration algorithm that relies on recursion: a node finds the next best solution by recursively finding the next best solutions of its children.
    Brief description of the algorithm: Each node maintains a priority queue DP_DecisionSet.pq_rec with the current candidates for the next best suffix solution (from the current node to the terminal).
    DP_Solution
    A solution to a DP problem is a path from the source node to the terminal node in the state-space graph.
    DP_Solution_Iterator
    An UNranked enumeration algorithm for a DP problem specified by a DP_Problem_Instance object.
    DP_State_Node
    A state-node in the multi-stage DP graph constructed by DP_Problem_Instance.bottom_up().
    DP_Suffix_Solution
    A suffix representation of DP solutions that allows for sharing common suffixes.
    DP_Take2
    Take2 is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements DP_Take2.get_successors(entities.paths.DP_Decision) by returning 2 successors instead of the single true one.
    Equality
    Contains methods that are useful for handling equality conditions.
    Equijoin
    This class provides a main function that receives execution parameters from the command line and runs experiments for equi-join queries.
    Equijoin_Converter
    This class contains methods that convert a theta-join query to an equi-join query.
    Join_Predicate
    A join predicate is a boolean formula that specifies a condition that needs to hold in order for 2 tuples (1 from each relation) to be joinable.
    JsonInput  
    JsonOption  
    JsonOptionParser  
    JsonParserTree
    JsonParserTree consists of end to end functions for running an any-k worker.
    JsonQuery
    This class represents JsonQuery from query.json file
    MainEntryPoint  
    Measurements
    A class that gathers timing and memory measurements during execution.
    Multiway_Partitioning
    Contains methods for efficiently representing (or factorizing) the query results of a join between 2 relations where the join condition is an arbitrary number of equalities and a single inequality/non-equality/band predicate.
    Naive_For_Verification  
    Node_Connector
    This class is responsible for connecting the nodes and creating the graph structure.
    NPRR
    Worst-case optimal join algorithm from Ngo et al., JACM'98 https://doi/10.1145/3180143.
    NPRR_Sort
    Worst-case optimal join algorithm from Ngo et al., JACM'98 https://doi/10.1145/3180143.
    OpenCsvWriter
    A class for writing results in different format to csv files
    Path_Batch
    This algorithm produces all the solutions to a DP problem specified as a DP_Problem_Instance object.
    Path_BatchHeap
    This algorithm produces all the solutions to a DP problem specified as a DP_Problem_Instance object and then puts them into a PQ (heap) so that it can return them in ranked order.
    Path_BatchSorting
    This algorithm produces all the solutions to a DP problem specified as a DP_Problem_Instance object and then sorts them so that it can return them in ranked order.
    Path_Equijoin
    This class provides a main function that receives execution parameters from the command line and runs experiments for equi-join queries where the joined relations are organized in a path.
    Path_Equijoin_Query
    An equi-join query where the relational atoms are organized in a path.
    Path_Inequalities
    This class provides a main function that receives execution parameters from the command line and runs experiments for join queries with inequalities (without disjunctions) where the joined relations are organized in a path.
    Path_Inequalities_Disjunction
    This class provides a main function that receives execution parameters from the command line and runs experiments for join queries with inequalities (that include disjunctions) where the joined relations are organized in a path.
    Path_Query_Solution
    A DP solution for problems that are equi-join path queries.
    Path_ThetaJoin_Query
    A theta-join query where the relational atoms are organized in a path.
    Relation
    A relation is an arraylist of tuples with a common list of attributes The schema of the relation specifies those attributes The relation is empty upon construction
    RelationParser
    This class parses each input record to create a Relation
    Shared_Ranges
    Contains methods for efficiently representing (or factorizing) the query results of a join between 2 relations where the join condition is an arbitrary number of equalities and a single inequality predicate.
    SimpleCycle_Anyk_Iterator
    A ranked enumeration algorithm for a conjunctive query that is a simple cycle of binary relations specified by a SimpleCycle_Equijoin_Query object.
    SimpleCycle_Equijoin
    This class provides a main function that receives execution parameters from the command line and runs experiments for equi-join queries where the joined relations are binary and organized in a simple cycle.
    SimpleCycle_Equijoin_Query
    An equi-join query where the relational atoms are binary and organized in a cycle.
    Star_Equijoin_Query
    An equi-join query where the relational atoms are organized in a star.
    State_Node  
    TDP_All
    All is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements TDP_All.get_successors(entities.trees.TDP_Decision) by treating all the non-optimal decisions as successors of the best (optimal) decision.
    TDP_Anyk_Iterator
    A ranked enumeration algorithm for a T-DP problem specified by a TDP_Problem_Instance object.
    TDP_BinaryStar_Equijoin_Instance
    A class for Τ-DP problems that are equi-join star queries with *binary relations*: A star query of size l involves one parent relation R1 and l-1 other relations hanging off of it.
    TDP_Decision
    A T-DP decision that corresponds to an edge in the tree-staged graph of T-DP.
    TDP_DecisionSet
    Class that represents a set of decisions (edges) in the tree-staged graph of T-DP.
    TDP_Eager
    Eager is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements TDP_Eager.get_successors(entities.trees.TDP_Decision) by sorting the decision set eagerly (upon the first visit with TDP_Eager.initialize_partial_order(entities.trees.TDP_DecisionSet)).
    TDP_Lazy
    Lazy is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements TDP_Lazy.get_successors(entities.trees.TDP_Decision) by popping them from a priority queue.
    TDP_Part
    Implementation of Anyk-Part for T-DP, a ranked enumeration algorithm that relies on the Lawler procedure.
    TDP_PartPlus
    Implementation of Anyk-PartMemoized for DP, a ranked enumeration algorithm that improves upon DP_Part by adding certain memoization.
    TDP_Prefix_Solution
    A prefix representation of T-DP solutions that allows for sharing common prefixes.
    TDP_Prefix_Solution_Follower
    A follower solution follows the order that some other "leading" prefix solution discovers.
    TDP_Problem_Instance
    An instance of a T-DP problem realized as a multi-stage graph of state-nodes where the stages are organized in a tree structure.
    TDP_Quick
    Quick is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements TDP_Quick.get_successors(entities.trees.TDP_Decision) by incrementally sorting the decision set with Incremental QuickSort (IQS).
    TDP_QuickPlus
    Quick is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements TDP_QuickPlus.get_successors(entities.trees.TDP_Decision) by incrementally sorting the decision set with Incremental QuickSort (IQS).
    TDP_Recursive
    Implementation of Anyk-Rec for T-DP, a ranked enumeration algorithm that relies on recursion: a node finds the next best solution by recursively finding the next best solutions of its children.
    Brief description of the algorithm: Each node maintains a priority queue TDP_DecisionSet.pq_rec for each branch of the tree with the current candidates for the next best subtree solution.
    TDP_Solution
    A solution to a T-DP problem is a tree from the source node to terminal nodes (one for each leaf stage) in the state-space graph.
    TDP_Star_Equijoin_Instance
    A class for Τ-DP problems that are equi-join star queries: A star query of size l involves one parent relation R1 and l-1 other relations hanging off of it.
    TDP_State_Node
    A state-node in the state-space graph of T-DP constructed by TDP_Problem_Instance.bottom_up().
    TDP_Subtree_Collection
    A collection of subtree solutions encoded as one solution plus a pointer to a shorter prefix.
    TDP_Subtree_Solution
    A subtree representation of T-DP solutions that allows for sharing common subtrees.
    TDP_Suffix_Solution
    A suffix representation of TDP solutions that allows for sharing common suffixes.
    TDP_Take2
    Take2 is a variant of Anyk-Part that implements TDP_Take2.get_successors(entities.trees.TDP_Decision) by returning 2 successors instead of the single true one.
    TDP_Thetajoin_Instance
    A class for Τ-DP problems that are theta-join tree queries.
    Tree_Batch
    This algorithm produces all the solutions to a T-DP problem specified as a TDP_Problem_Instance object.
    Tree_BatchSorting
    This algorithm produces all the solutions to a T-DP problem specified as a TDP_Problem_Instance object and then sorts them so that it can return them in ranked order.
    Tree_Query_Solution
    A T-DP solution for problems that are equi-join acyclic (tree) queries.
    Tree_ThetaJoin_Query
    A theta-join query where the relational atoms are organized in a tree.
    Tuple
    A database tuple with some associated cost The attribute list of the tuple must agree with the schema of the relation it belongs to
    Yannakakis
    ArrayList-based implementation of the Yannakakis algorithm for acyclic queries.
    YannakakisSorting
    ArrayList-based implementation of the Yannakakis algorithm for acyclic queries.
